Family Webinar: Social Emotional Learning & Well-Being, Sept. 10 at 6 p.m.

We’re adding another webinar to our family series. The District focuses on more than only academics. We believe it is our responsibility to educate the whole child for success in school and their future. SHS PHASE 1 CONSTRUCTION UPDATE

Progress continues on several aspects of the Phase 1 Expansion of Sumner High School! Here’s the latest on this 2016 Bond project, which is on schedule for completion in Fall 2022:

-- Removing 8 portable classrooms and 2 office trailers, making way for 36 parking stalls to be added back in the North Lot for use when school starts.

-- Dry weather is allowing us to now complete work on the District-owned vacant lots around SHS. Finishing work includes filling in foundations and final site stabilization.

-- The City of Sumner is reviewing parking lot plans for the vacant lot next to the Elhi Hill High School Program on Meeker Street across from SHS. With this parking lot expansion, a total of 53 parking stalls will serve both Elhi Hill and SHS.

-- Value engineering study is complete. The construction team will present implementation and design development plans to the School Board on Aug. 19. A link to the virtual board meeting will be posted online at www.sumnersd.org/schoolboard at least 24 hours prior to the meeting on the “agendas & minutes” page.

School- and child-specific programs include:
- Special education, Head Start, after-school programs, and classroom technology
- Food assistance, including free and reduced-price school meals
- Maternal and child health programs

Learn more at www.sumnersd.org/census

Sumner, Bonney Lake high schools keep state sports classification, leagues

Every four years, the Washington Interscholastic Activities Association works with Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction data submitted by school districts to determine school classification, which is based on the average enrollment in grades 9 through 11.

Here are the classifications and league alignments for SBLSD’s two high schools for 2020-24:
· Bonney Lake High School: Remains a member of the 3A Pierce County League. Other high schools in the league include Lakes, Spanaway Lake, Lincoln, Mt. Tahoma, Stadium and Wilson.
· Sumner High School: Opted up to 4A and remains a member of the South Puget Sound League (SPSL). Other SPSL members include Bethel, Graham-Kapowsin, Emerald Ridge, Rogers, Puyallup, Curtis, Bellarmine, Olympia and South Kitsap.

BLHS Students Design City’s Banners:
We imagine you’ve driven through Bonney Lake a lot in the past month. But have you noticed new banners hanging from light posts along the highway? Last spring, the City of Bonney Lake - Government partnered with BLHS’s Creative Design class to come up with designs that denote each of the city’s three main sections: Midtown, Downtown and Eastown. Macey and Mackenzie came up with the colors, fonts and imagery for the banners, which total 21 citywide. Next time you're in Bonney Lake, and um, maybe stuck in traffic 😉, take a look at these special banners.

post_text: Daffodil Valley Elementary students started this school year with much-needed and greatly-anticipated new playground equipment -- thanks to valuable partnerships, donations and volunteers! The new playground structure, designed to accommodate children ages 5 to 12, features bridges, ramps, climbers, ladders and slides. Purchase of the $34,000 structure was a group fundraising effort between DVE’s PTA and Rotary Club of Sumner. We very much appreciate Sumner Rotary’s generous donation of nearly $26,000, which made this new playground possible. Superintendent Dent and former Sumner Rotary President and Sumner Police Department Chief Brad Moericke spoke before a crowd of partners, volunteers, elected officials and families who celebrated the official opening of the playground with a ribbon cutting ceremony at the school’s Back-to-School Barbecue on Aug. 29.

Emerald Hills Elementary earns State Recognized School distinction! Emerald Hills Elementary is among 216 schools across the state recognized for performance, or progress in closing the opportunity and achievement gaps. Emerald Hills earned the new State Recognized School distinction as one of the highest achieving schools in English language arts and math.

The achievement is based on students performing at or above the state average in Smarter Balanced Assessments over the past three years.

Developed by the State Board of Education, the Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction and the Educational Opportunity Gap Oversight and Accountability Committee, the state’s newly-redesigned recognition system will be revised in phases over three years to more equitably recognize schools.

Congratulations to Emerald Hills’ students and staff for their dedication and focus in earning this award!

In addition to this impressive lump sum that will cover half of Lianne’s tuition, she’s earned thousands of dollars in other scholarships for her participation in the school's DECA club, which focuses on business and marketing.

Lianne is incredibly invested and actively engaged in the Sumner School District CTE program by taking on leadership roles, participating in international DECA competitions and competing with Bonney Lake’s award-winning culinary team. After college, Lianne aspires to own her own bakery!
